# California DRE 2025-2026 New Requirements

## Legislative Changes Affecting Real Estate Licensing

### SB 1495 - Implicit Bias & Fair Housing (Effective January 1, 2024)
All Real Estate Practice courses must now include:

**Implicit Bias Education:**
- Impact of implicit bias on real estate transactions
- Historical context (redlining, restrictive covenants)
- Actionable steps to recognize and address bias

**Fair Housing Component:**
- Interactive role-play exercises
- Must experience scenarios as BOTH consumer AND agent
- Covers protected classes under Fair Housing Act

**Applies to:** All applications received on/after January 1, 2024

### Digitally Altered Photos Disclosure (Effective January 1, 2026)
**NEW REQUIREMENT:**
- Must disclose if listing photos are AI-generated or materially altered
- Must provide original, unedited photos upon request
- Applies to: virtual staging, sky replacement, enhanced landscaping, removed items

**Not covered:**
- Standard color correction
- Cropping
- Minor brightness/contrast adjustments

### FinCEN Reporting (Effective March 1, 2026)
**Federal Requirement:**
- Reporting required for all-cash residential purchases involving:
  - LLCs, trusts, or other legal entities
  - Shell companies
- **Purpose:** Anti-money laundering compliance
- **Impact:** Additional due diligence for agents handling entity purchases

### Transit-Oriented Housing (Mid-2026)
- Limits local zoning restrictions near major transit stations
- Creates opportunities for higher-density development
- Agents should understand impact on property values near transit

### Continuing Education Updates (First Renewal)
Required 45-hour CE includes:
- Ethics (3 hours)
- Agency (3 hours)
- Trust Fund Handling (3 hours)
- Risk Management (3 hours)
- Fair Housing with interactive role-play (3 hours)
- **NEW: Implicit Bias Training (2 hours)**
- Consumer Protection courses (18 hours minimum)
- Broker additional: Management and Supervision (3 hours)

### Official Source
https://www.dre.ca.gov/licensees/cerequirements.html
